vulnerability_information:
Hi , 
the behavior found in some of programs that need to `Apply to this program` like @hackthedts this program need to your submit Application before start found/send bug to them .
this button have no any validations/check protect for CSRF bug , that can lead to auto apply to program by used this link `https://hackerone.com/hackthedts?apply=true`

#POC 
this CSRF work fine with user that have a tax confirm or had an bounty get before .
1- open this link https://hackerone.com/hackthedts?apply=true
2- if you login-in you will see that your apply has been send successfully , if not login you will redirect to login page then the apply will take a place automatic 
 


### Optional: Your Environment (Browser version, Device, etc)

 * any

this should be an step to confirm the apply or an additional step to be sure what the user/research will do .

## Impact

this can be used to send massive apply with only open link

Hi @jobert i want add more information about the CSRF , i found that hackerone used the `Referrer` as an a way to protect form from CSRF with `token` in POST method an some a GET method . the `Referrer` can be bypass if the hacker/research found an GET CSRF .
the bypass work as bellow send a GET link to victim as https://www.hackerone.com/hackthedts?apply=true the site will show an 404 error page then redirect the victim to https://hackerone.com/hackthedts?apply=true when the redirect made the `Referrer` will be set as `https://www.hackerone.com/hackthedts?apply=true` and request will made successfully .
this can help any attacker if he/her found a way to bypass the `token` and looking for something to bypass the `Referrer`  .

Hi @jobert 
I would like to share this logical behavior that lead your site to load understand format at response , I notices that you used HTML as the first response then following it with JSON files and the result will be as you want but I found that if you add extension HTML for same link for example `/bugs.html  ` and open the link the response request will fall in logic behavior that lead duplicate the first step in second one and have the content-type as text/html  `content-type: text/html; charset=utf-8` not as  `content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8` in response ,wish lead to load a white page and it’s not show the error page as should the site do in other case that if you used extensions `asp,php,shtml,htm,aspx etc` .
This behavior work in some places like in inbox section /reports in report  id not all places .
This behavior is not effect users/teams but it actually in the way that should header doing in case that used the extension `html` .

#POC 
Any file/path at hackerone will open in 2 steps first will request the html file then following it with other JSON files/request to show the content , here will break this step by adding the extension `html` to the end of file and that will lead to duplicate  the step 1 again with same extensions but with different  content at `Accept` parameter in header request and result will be like this :

#first file request header 
```
GET /bugs.html HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
```
##second file request
```
GET /bugs.html HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://hackerone.com/bugs.html
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
```
##response 
```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Wed, 30 May 2018 02:08:30 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Connection: close
Cache-Control: private, no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate
Content-Disposition: inline; filename="response.html"
X-Request-Id: 8abb4755-be27-42b2-859e-87d4162673fe
```
As you see that request send as ` XMLHttpRequest ` , ` application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
` which should return with `content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8` but it did not happen here .

still doing more investigate about this one if maybe lead to bypass the CSP or other header security protection , and i want ask if this kind of behavior are accepted by you ?
